title: FirebaseRealtimeDatabase Java Class Documentation
introduction: The FirebaseRealtimeDatabase class is a Java implementation for interacting with a Firebase Realtime Database. It provides methods to read, write, update, and delete data in the database.
initialization: To use the FirebaseRealtimeDatabase class, create an instance of the class. The class is initialized with the Firebase Realtime Database URL.

methods.name: Read Data
methods.description: Use the `readData` method to retrieve data from the database at a specified path.

methods.name: Write Data
methods.description: Use the `writeData` method to write data to the database at a specified path.

methods.name: Update Data
methods.description: Use the `updateData` method to update data in the database at a specified path.

methods.name: Delete Data
methods.description: Use the `deleteData` method to delete data from the database at a specified path.

error_handling: Each method returns either data or a success status (true or false). Ensure you handle errors appropriately based on the return values.
conclusion: The FirebaseRealtimeDatabase Java class allows you to interact with a Firebase Realtime Database in your Java applications. Use the provided methods to read, write, update, and delete data as needed.
